author: Atomic Shrimp
description:
I had a load of duck fat left over from Christmas dinner - and I wondered what it would be like if I made lardy cake, but using the duck fat in place of lard...

Join the Atomic Shrimp official Discord server for FREE early access to videos! - https://discord.gg/atomicshrimp
Atomic Shrimp subreddit: https://www.reddit.com/r/AtomicShrimp/

Timestamps:
0:00 Intro
0:29 Dough
2:20 Filling
3:01 What is lardy cake?
5:02 Assembly
10:10 Baking
10:28 Glaze and topping
13:05 Finishing
16:18 Tasting and thoughts

Recipe notes:
Bread dough ingredients:
25g fat
500g flour
300ml water
5g Yeast (fast action/instant or your own preference)
1 teaspoon mixed spice
1 teaspoon sugar
½ teaspoon salt

Filling ingredients:
125g fat (a little of this will be used to grease the tin)
125g fruit (sultanas or raisins)
125g sugar (brown or white or mixed)

Topping ingredients:
1 orange (zest and some of the juice)
3 tablespoons icing sugar
1 tablespoon demerera sugar
(optional) finely crushed crispy rendered duck
title: What Do You Get if You Make Lardy Cake With Duck Fat?
